enhanced_by.reason: The text() method extracts combined text from elements, which can be used to set up the state for eachText() by ensuring elements have text content.
The hasText() method checks if any element has non-blank text content, which can be used to verify the presence of text before invoking eachText().
Both eachText() and text() methods extract text from elements, making text() a good candidate for constructing assertions to validate the output of eachText().
The hasText() method can be used to assert that elements with text are correctly identified by eachText().
